responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Arbitrary Command Injection in build-app-iconset.sh
    analysis: |
      The build-app-iconset.sh script is vulnerable to command injection due to the use of user-supplied input in the inkscape command. An attacker could craft a malicious SVG file that, when passed to the script, could execute arbitrary commands on the system.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names:
      - inkscape
    filenames:
      - icons/build-app-iconset.sh
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Arbitrary Command Injection in build-document-iconset.sh
    analysis: |
      The build-document-iconset.sh script is vulnerable to command injection due to the use of user-supplied input in the inkscape command. An attacker could craft a malicious SVG file that, when passed to the script, could execute arbitrary commands on the system.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names:
      - inkscape
    filenames:
      - icons/build-document-iconset.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Arbitrary Command Injection in build-app-iconset.sh
leads.analysis: The build-app-iconset.sh script is vulnerable to command injection due to the use of user-supplied input in the inkscape command. An attacker could craft a malicious SVG file that, when passed to the script, could execute arbitrary commands on the system.

leads.headline: Arbitrary Command Injection in build-document-iconset.sh
leads.analysis: The build-document-iconset.sh script is vulnerable to command injection due to the use of user-supplied input in the inkscape command. An attacker could craft a malicious SVG file that, when passed to the script, could execute arbitrary commands on the system.
